sentence.text: He just told you off for being a pain , I bet !
I sling a few carcasses to prowling cats , and I get told off for it .
She told herself off for not being attentive enough , for not finding the right words to encourage him to go on .
His mum must have told him off for being such a cheat .
And I got told off for it .
He very quickly told me off because I was a bit absentminded .
Her parents were always telling her off for going on about things being boring .
She very rarely got told off and when she did it upset her .
Often the glutton in Diana got the better of her and she was frequently told off for dipping her fingers into pans filled with gooey sauces .
I 'm never late for things , I try really hard to be late , but I just ca n't be because we were told off so much about it .
He got told off by Mister C. It 's inevitable , I suppose .
I get told off by my girlfriend because I wake up in the morning and the first thing I say is , ` Flippin' heck , have you sent those newsletters off yet ? . "
So it 's unusual and I get told off for giving you a choice but what do you think ?
Ricky got told off .
I got told off by the ref -- I was a bit wild then -- and Ian began moaning as though he was crying .
And Mum 's always telling me off for doing things wrong .
` You told me off once , " said Gazzer , ` for bumping into you in the corridors . "
I finned madly for the surface , and was told off very severely for making an ascent like a pricked balloon .
Dutch police told off two of the gang , aged 10 and 11 .
Mummy 's voice was colder , as if she thought Rebecca had meant to tell her off .
M. B. If you were lucky you might just get told off by the superintendent or you might go up before the chief constable where you could be fined .
Whatever they could stick their noses into they would , like telling you off if you had more than eight photos on your pin board .
She slumped in her chair and waited to be told off .
You expect to be told off and you 're not .
We 'd get told off .
